#Text=Richard
#Text=Herbert ( died 1510 )
#Text=For other people of this name , see Richard Herbert .
#Text=Arms of Herbert : Per pale azure and gules , three lions rampant argent
#Text=Sir
#Text=Richard Herbert
#Text=Kt
#Text=( died 1510 ) of Ewyas , Herefordshire , was an English knight , gentleman , landowner , and courtier .
#Text=He was an illegitimate son of William Herbert , 1st Earl of Pembroke , and Maud , a daughter of Adam ap Howell Graunt ( Gwynn ) . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ]
#Text=Richard had a full brother named George . [ 3 ]
#Text=Richard Herbert of Ewyas should not be confused with his uncle , Sir Richard Herbert of Coldbrook , a brother of his father , William Herbert , 1st Earl of Pembroke . [ 4 ]
#Text=Herbert legacy

#Text=The titles and estates of the Earl of Pembroke descended to Herbert 's younger , legitimate half-brother William , [ 3 ] but he achieved notability through his own merit and through his descendants : " Sir Richard Herbert , of Ewyas , who , though illegitimate , is ancestor of the men who have really , in modern times , rendered the name of Herbert illustrious .

#Text=While Herbert is most often named as  Sir Richard Herbert , " there is uncertainty as to whether he was knighted .

column1: #Text=In "

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The Knights of England  , there is a record of a Richard Herbert being knighted in 1513 , but that was three years after this man 's death . [ 7 ]

column1: #Text=Marriage
#Text=Richard married Margaret , a daughter of Sir Matthew Cradock of Swansea and of Alice ( or Jane ) Mancell , widow of John Malefant . [ 1 ]
#Text=Sir Matthew Cradock was receiver of Glamorgan , [ 3 ] through whom Castleston Castle passed to his daughter Margaret and Richard Herbert . [ 9 ]
#Text=Issue

#Text=Richard and Margaret Herbert had three surviving sons , one of whom was William Herbert , 1st Earl of Pembroke , who became the 1st Earl of Pembroke of the second creation [ 5 ] on 11 October 1551 . [ 3 ]
#Text=Later Earls of Pembroke [ 2 ] and Montgomery , and of Carnarvon , and the Dukes of Powis , of Pool Castle ( extinct 1747 ) , descend from Sir Richard Herbert .
#Text=Through a female line the Marquis of Bute derives his Glamorganshire estates . [ 5 ]
#Text=Herbert 's son William married Anne Parr , sister of Queen Catherine Parr , the sixth and last wife of Henry VIII .
#Text=William served Henry VIII in many capacities , including Chief Gentleman of the Privy Chamber , Privy Councillor , and Receiver of the King 's revenues .
#Text=He was knighted in 1544 and later appointed a Knight of the Garter . [ 4 ]
#Text=Another son was Sir George Herbert of Swansea , [ 10 ] who was ancestor of the Herberts of Swansea , Cogan , Cookham , and the White Friars , who became extinct in 1739 .
#Text=Candleston Castle
#Text=passed from Richard and Margaret to their son George . [ 9 ]
#Text=Richard was also the father of the illegitimate Herberts of Dinas Powis and Hengastell . [ 11 ]
#Text=Death
#Text=Richard Herbert died between 2 and 12 September 1510 and was buried in Abergavenny Church ; his tomb has a lavishly decorated wall arch and an alabaster effigy . [ 1 ] [ 12 ]
